result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D Werther was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at #14CF448 and #20CF104 called at 2:55pm 
Defendant Eric D Werther in court, in custody, with Attorney Annette E Rauch.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments are given by counsel.  Mr. Werther makes a statement. 
recess 3:21pm, reconvene 3:28pm.

On Case #14CF448-Count #5 the Court sentences Mr. Werther to:
--serve one year in Jefferson County Jail, with no Huber privileges  
--396 days credit for time already served given  
The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay any balance due on court financial obligations. Non-payment shall result in the entry of a civil judgment.
___________________
On Case #20CF104-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Werther to:
--serve 120 days Jefferson County Jail, consecutive to Case #14CF448.  The first 60 days of this jail term are to be served without Huber privileges. As to the remaining portion of the term which is with Huber release privileges the Court requires Mr. Werther to serve the term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--0 days credit for time already served given 
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full. Non-payment shall result in the entry of a civil judgment.
recess 3:42pm

NEXT:  Clerk --once total due is calculated please send Mr. Werther a payment slip
Sentencing Hearing 8-18-15
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 14, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Cases 14CF448 and 20CF104 called together at 11:16 AM [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Eric D Werther appears from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. Attorney Annette E Rauch appears.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 20CF104: ADA Witt moves to amend Count #1 to Misdemeanor Batter, Repeater; files an Amended Information; Attorney Rauch verifies receipt.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered to Count #1 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Count #2 of Case 20CF104.

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by ADA Witt

Upon further review of the file, the Court realizes a Revocation Packet was not submitted in Case 14CF448

recess: 11:45am--reconvene: 1:03pm
All Appearances are the same. 

The Court now verifies receipt and review of revocation packet. 

The Court raises that the Court has not received a sentencing transcript; while Atty. Rauch is willing to waive, the Court is not. 

The Court directs the sentencing court reporter to file a sentencing transcript. 

recess: 1:11pm 
NEXT: Sentencing Heraing on Revocation(14CF448) & Sentencing (20CF104) on 8/14/20 at 2:30pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 28, 2020 at 11:15 am. (rescheduled to an earlier date at the request of Atty. Rauch.

[MK] During a Branch I hearing on this date in pending Case #20CF104 (with appearances by Zoom-conference) Defendant Eric D Werther appeared from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Annette E Rauch appeared.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared representing the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rauch indicated that the Defense has received confirmation that Mr. Werther is being revoked in Case #14CF448, and that the parties have reached a global agreement as to both the revocation-case and pending case #20CF104. Attorney Rauch requested that the hearing be scheduled on a date when the parties can appear in person at the sentencing. 
On request of both counsel, the Court indicated that Mr. Werther's Case #14CF448 is to be assigned to Branch I.  

NEXT: Sentencing After Revocation in Branch I on 8/18/20 at 2:30pm with in-person appearances

Case called at 8:46 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Eric D Werther in court with Attorney Steven Michael Cohen. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statements by Mr. Werther

On Count #5, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 5 years, with conditions:
--serve 7 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for AODA treatment, employment & child care; to commence 9/1/15 by 8:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No use of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Monthly testing for illegal drug use for the 1st 12 months and then at discretion of agent
--No contact with Joshua Somers
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $99 subpoena fees
--To pay $25 drug testing fees
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given

Sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 08:30 am
with attached criminal case settlement

Case called at 2:00 pm [sf]  [Case was set for Final Status/Scheduling Conference]
Defendant Eric D Werther in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Cohen advises that they are ready to proceed to a plea and sentencing at a later date.
Court and Attorney Cohen discuss possible plea today.
Attorney Cohen advises that he and ADA Shock have discussed that he needs to provide evidence of treatment and that he wanted to provide reference letters to the State.
Court and Attorney Cohen discuss scheduling and trial.
Court will reconvene in a half hour, to allow Attorney Cohen time to discuss case with ADA Shock.
recess: 2:07 pm
reconvene: 2:53 pm

Attorney Cohen informs the Court that the parties agree that the defendant will plea to Count #5 other counts will be read-in and dismissed, Both parties will recommend 5 years probation and both parties are free to agrue all other conditions of probation. Prosecution will recommend 9 months jail as a condition of probation.

DA Happ submits a criminal case settlement.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining counts pertaining to this defendant.

Attorney Cohen requests sentencing be set out about a month.
DA Happ requests sentencing about a week or 2 out.

Court will note that it will try to set out as close to the 2 week time frame as possible.

recess: 3:07 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Sentencing Hearing: to be set (Atty Cohen to go back to find a date with JA)
